laboratory_examinations.findings: Very low T-cell counts; B-cell counts normal, eosinophilia (1000 cells per cubic millimeter)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: T-cell counts low at 10 months, gradually increased until age of 2 years, but remained below normal values.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Maternal lymphocytes could not be detected in the blood.
Elevated serum immunoglobulin levels, with specific measurements not provided.
No antibodies detected after immunization with tetanus toxoid, diphtheria toxoid and poliovirus.
90% of circulating T cells with low levels of T-cell receptor–CD3 complex, 10% with normal levels.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Normal levels of the T-cell receptor–CD3 complex were detected after mutations; however, T-cell receptor signaling remained defective.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Impaired T-cell proliferation compared to controls; partial restoration of response with interleukin-2.
ZAP-70 present but not phosphorylated in T cells with normal levels of T-cell receptor–CD3 complex.
